page.title: 11Barnston, Lt Dunmow, Felsted
page.content:
Informal education for children starts at the age of about three when they attend the local village playgroups for a few hours per week. There are playgroups in Barnston and Felsted where there is also a private nursery and preparatory school known as Felsted Kindergarten School.
Although Felsted is dominated by private education, most of the local children enter the state system at the age of five, which in Felsted means going to school just outside the main village, and from Barnston and Little Dunmow they travel to Great Dunmow.
At the age of eleven up to eighteen years, the majority of children travel to the Comprehensive School at Great Dunmow.
